entry.title: horned sungem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the horned sungem (example pictured) is sometimes a nectar robber?

entry.title: music of Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the music of Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance was designed to be reactive to the player's actions?

entry.title: Arthur Lewis Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that from 1904 to 1911 Arthur Lewis Hall covered 17,479 miles (28,130 km), mostly on foot, to map the geology of the Transvaal?

entry.title: a Rhode Island TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Rhode Island TV station broadcast for 14 months and then was off the air for 26 years before returning?

entry.title: María Esther Biscayart de Tello (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that all three of María Esther Biscayart de Tello's children were forcibly disappeared during the Dirty War in Argentina?

entry.title: Babe Ruth's funeral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Life magazine said that Babe Ruth's funeral was the "kind of tribute normally reserved for kings and presidents"?

entry.title: Mary Clutter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Clutter used her directorial position at the National Science Foundation to require scientific conferences to include women speakers when presenting research done by them?

entry.title: 2012 pregnancy hoax (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Taubaté became the "city of lies" after a 2012 pregnancy hoax?
